quotes.quote: The art of acceptance is the art of making someone who has just done you a small favor wish that he might have done you a greater one.
Obedience of the law is demanded; not asked as a favor.
When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.

The longer you hang in there, the greater the chance that something will happen in your favor. No matter how hard it seems, the longer you persist, the more likely your success. Read more at: https://www.brainyquote.com/quotes/jack_canfield_637636
Chance favors the prepared mind.
Friends don't count the cost of favors.
No favor can win gratitude from a cat.
A favor is never so long-lived as a grudge.
No wind favors he who has no destined port.
This is a universe that does not favor the timid.
Never claim as a right what you can ask as a favor.
Live life as if everything is rigged in your favor.
One person can bring favor to many during the storm.
The friendship of a great man is a favor of the gods.
Gratitude is merely the secret hope of further favors.
I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
Fortune does favor the bold and you'll never know what you're capable of if you don't try.
Fortune and love favor the brave.
The bird thinks it a favor to give the fish a lift in the air.
He who boasts of a favor bestowed, would like it back again.
Heaven goes by favor. If it went by merit, you would stay out and your dog would go in.
That man is worthless who knows how to receive a favor, but not how to return one.
It is the characteristic of the magnanimous man to ask no favor but to be ready to do kindness to others.
The least productive people are usually the ones who are most in favor of holding meetings.
There is no safety in regaining the favor of an enemy
Favor and honor sometimes fall more fitly on those who do not desire them.
If even dying is to be made a social function, then, grant me the favor of sneaking out on tiptoe without disturbing the party.
Goals allow you to control the direction of change in your favor.
The odds will always favor the man with a plan.
To refuse graciously is to confer a favor.
The ideal man takes joy in doing favors for others.
If you want to make a friend, let someone do you a favor.
Most of the change we think we see in life is due to truths being in and out of favor.
People who demand neutrality in any situation are usually not neutral but in favor of the status quo.
We secure our friends not by accepting favours but by doing them.
Never forget the favors done for you. Always forget the favors you’ve done for others.
If we do what is necessary, all the odds are in our favor.
